item.title: Setting Up the New Windows Terminal
item.description: Microsoft announced the release of the new windows terminal back in May this year with an eye-catching video. And it’s opensource. WARNING! It is still in preview. Prerequisites You should be on atleast Windows Version 1903 (build 18362) or. Desktop Bridge VC++ v14 Redistributable Package (For Manual Installation) Installation There are three methods of installing the Terminal. From Microsoft Store (with automatic updates)

item.title: Getting Started with Visual Studio Code
item.description: Everybody who writes, let it be a story, a piece of code or maybe to take a few notes or something, you need a text editor. This is where VSCode comes in. It can do all a simple note-taking app can do and much more. With extensions you can extend the functionality of the editor. For example, with Better Fountain extension you can write and format screenplays. In this article, you’ll learn about installing and basic setup and an overview of some of its features and extensions.

item.title: Contact
item.description: If you have any requests or queries, please reach out. Your Name Email Address An email address is required. Message
